title: Wally and Sam produce goods X and Y, trade

content.prompt: Wally can make 40 units of good X or 30 units of good Y in a day, and Sam can make 20 units of good X or 10 units of good Y in a day. Assuming constant trade-offs between good X and good Y, which of the following is true?

choices.label: Sam has a comparative advantage in making good X.
Sam has a comparative advantage in making good Y.
Wally has a comparative advantage in making both goods.
Sam has an absolute advantage in making good X.
Sam has an absolute advantage in making good Y.

topic.text: 1.3: Comparative Advantage and Gains from Trade

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
